Company Name

Identified few key tools missing in site's Maximo.
Got it enabled from HQ IT team for 1000+ AAM Global Maximo users.
Expanded existing facility Maximo user count by 50%.
Provided problem solving support and training to Maximo users.
Created, assigned and scheduled Preventive Maintenance (PM) and Predictive Maintenance (PD) plans.

Champion for Spindle Vibration Analysis program.
Train tradesmen to gather Vibe data, analyse trends & recommend repairs.
Implement 5S Methodology in toolroom.
Performed GP-12 quality inspection in Production Part Approval Process (PPAP).
Investigate part failures by studying Electrical, Hydraulic and Pneumatic equipment prints using AutoCAD.
Plan and coordinate Maint operations with Production team to minimize equipment downtime and maximize production.
Identify new, damaged or obsolete parts in store using ORACLE and coordinate with Purchasing Dept to buy it in.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Maintenance Manager

Location: Napoleon, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
JAC Products has an opportunity for aMaintenance Managerto join our team in Napoleon, Ohio. In this role, you will lead the plant maintenance department as it relates to installation, repair and upkeep of the facility, including machines, mechanical systems, buildings and other structures.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

 Responsible for the compliance of all health and safety requirements.  Responsible for the coordination and direction of all maintenance employees that are assigned to the facility and/or Business Unit.  Develop and manage maintenance procedures and ensure the proper implementation and adherence  Management of the professional performance development of the maintenance employees (skilled trades development program).  Responsible for coordinating the procurement and receipt of replacement parts for projects within the facility.  Develop and manage key maintenance metrics, such as PMs completed, rework, downtime, open work orders, time to repair, etc., and develop systems, processes, and activities to improve metrics. 

SKILLS:

 A bility to use all types of tools and Shop Equipment (manual, electric, pneumatic, etc…). Advanced computer skills, including use of Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and other programs; capable of learning to use AS400, Lotus Notes, and MapicsAdvanced communication skills - both written & oral.  Mechanically inclined.  Excellent organizational skills and problem solving capabilities.  This position is able to work without supervision.  Shall be competent reading both hydraulic and electrical blueprints, as well as mechanical drawings. 

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

 4 year technical degree, Journey Worker Certification, or at least 15 years of equivalent job-related experience.  Three to seven years of experience in hydraulics or electrical maintenance is preferred.  Three to seven years of experience of supervisory/project management experience in a manufacturing environment. 

JAC Products has been a pioneer in the Tier I automotive space for over 50 years and continues to test the limits of functional exterior trim products. We use advanced engineering techniques and cutting-edge technology to design products that enhance the style and utility of vehicles. JAC Products has operation or production capabilities on four continents and continues to expand our presence in the United States and globally.

We offer medical, dental, vision, and paid time off as well as many other benefits in a collaborative culture that focuses on innovation and teamwork.

JAC Products is an equal opportunity employer and gives equal consideration for employment to qualified applicants.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
